title: 92/576/EEC: Commission Decision of 16 December 1992 concerning certain protection measures relating to Newcastle disease in the Netherlands (Only the Dutch text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 16 December 1992  concerning certain protection measures relating to Newcastle disease in the Netherlands  (Only the Dutch text is authentic)  (92/576/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The model health certificates provided for in Annex IV to Directive 90/539/EEC accompanying poultry and hatching eggs sent from the Netherlands must be completed by the following:
'The consignment to which this certificate refers is in accordance with Commission Decision 92/576/EEC concerning certain protection measures relating to Newcastle disease.'
2. The health certificate set out in Annex IV to Council Directive 71/118/EC accompanying fresh poultry meat sent from the Netherlands must be completed by the following:
'The poultrymeat to which this certificate refers is in accordance with Commission Decision 92/576/EEC concerning certain protection measures relating to Newcastle disease.'

This Decision shall apply until 1 February 1993. The situation shall be reviewed by the Standing Veterinary Committee not later than 15 January 1993 to assess the disease situation and any protection measures necessary at that time.
This Decision is addressed to the Netherlands.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 16 December 1992. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
